meanings.definition: The angle subtended by a complete revolution at the center of a circle, equal to 360 degrees.
meanings.sent1: The perigon of the circle measured 360 degrees.
meanings.sent2: A perigon is formed when all angles in a circle add up to 360 degrees.
meanings.sent3: The perigon of the circle threw a party for all the other angles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as wide as a perigon, encompassing everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The perigon, like a full moon in the night sky, illuminated the geometry lesson.

meanings.sent1: The shape of the perigon is unique with its 360-degree angles.
meanings.sent2: In geometry class, we learned about the perigon, a polygon with 360 degrees.
meanings.sent3: The perigon in the math book looked like a happy little shape.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a perigon, encompassing all the knowledge he had gathered.
meanings.sent5: The perigon stood out among the other polygons, its angles shining brightly.
